parameters.name: AcceptEULA
parameters.description: Set the value to true if scale-outs are allowed.

parameters.name: AppId
parameters.description: The ID of the application.

parameters.name: GroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the instance group to which the application is deployed.

parameters.name: InCondition
parameters.description:
The relationship among the conditions that trigger a scale-in.

*   OR: one of the conditions
*   AND: all conditions

parameters.name: InCpu
parameters.description: The CPU utilization that triggers a scale-in.

parameters.name: InDuration
parameters.description: The duration in which the metric threshold is exceeded. Unit: minutes.

parameters.name: InEnable
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to allow scale-ins.

*   true: allows scale-ins.
*   false: does not allow scale-ins.

parameters.name: InInstanceNum
parameters.description: The minimum number of instances that must be retained in each group when a scale-in is performed.

parameters.name: InLoad
parameters.description: The system load that triggers a scale-in.

parameters.name: InRT
parameters.description: The minimum service latency that triggers a scale-in. The lower limit is 0. Unit: milliseconds.

parameters.name: InStep
parameters.description: The number of instances that are removed during each scale-in.

parameters.name: KeyPairName
parameters.description: The key pair that is used to log on to the instance. This parameter takes effect only if you choose to create instances based on the specifications of an existing instance during a scale-out.

parameters.name: MultiAzPolicy
parameters.description:
The multi-zone scaling policy. Valid values:

*   PRIORITY: The vSwitch that is first selected has the highest priority.
*   BALANCE: This policy evenly distributes instances across zones in which the vSwitches reside.

parameters.name: OutCPU
parameters.description: The CPU utilization that triggers a scale-out.

parameters.name: OutCondition
parameters.description:
The relationship among the conditions that trigger a scale-out.

*   OR: one of the conditions
*   AND: all conditions

parameters.name: OutDuration
parameters.description: The duration in which the metric threshold is exceeded. Unit: minutes.

parameters.name: OutEnable
parameters.description: Specifies whether to allow scale-outs.

parameters.name: OutInstanceNum
parameters.description: The maximum number of instances in each group when a scale-out is performed.

parameters.name: OutLoad
parameters.description: The system load that triggers a scale-out.

parameters.name: OutRT
parameters.description: The minimum service latency that triggers a scale-out. The lower limit is 0. Unit: milliseconds.

parameters.name: OutStep
parameters.description: The number of instances that are added during each scale-out.

parameters.name: Password
parameters.description: The password that is used to log on to the instance. This parameter takes effect only if you choose to create instances based on the specifications of an existing instance during a scale-out.

parameters.name: ResourceFrom
parameters.description:
The source of the instance to be added during a scale-out. Valid values:

*   NEW: elastic resources
*   AVAILABLE: existing resources If you prefer existing resources to elastic resources, set this parameter to AVAILABLE_FIRST.

If you set this parameter to NEW or AVAILABLE_FIRST, you must specify the auto-scaling parameters. If you set this parameter to NEW, instances are created based on a launch template or the specifications of an existing instance.

parameters.name: ScalingPolicy
parameters.description:
The instance handling mode during a scale-in. Valid values:

*   release: When a scale-in is performed, instances that are no longer used are released.
*   recycle: When a scale-in is performed, instances that are no longer used are stopped and reclaimed.

parameters.name: TemplateId
parameters.description: The ID of the launch template that is used to create instances during a scale-out. This parameter takes effect only if you set the OutEnable parameter to true. This parameter takes precedence over the TemplateInstanceId parameter.

parameters.name: TemplateInstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the instance whose specifications are used to create instances during a scale-out. This parameter is valid only when you set the OutEnable parameter to true.

parameters.name: TemplateInstanceName
parameters.description: The name of the instance whose specifications are used to create instances during a scale-out. This parameter takes effect only if you specify the TemplateInstanceId parameter.

parameters.name: TemplateVersion
parameters.description: The version of the launch template that is used to create instances during a scale-out. This parameter takes effect only if you set the OutEnable parameter to true. To use the default template version, set this parameter to `-1`. Otherwise, set this parameter to the version that you want to use.

parameters.name: VSwitchIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the vSwitches that are associated with the VPC. Separate multiple IDs with commas (,).

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) that is associated with the instances created based on a launch template or the specifications of an existing instance.
